This is an [R Markdown](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com) Notebook. When you execute code within the notebook, the results appear beneath the code. 

Try executing this chunk by clicking the *Run* button within the chunk or by placing your cursor inside it and pressing *Cmd+Shift+Enter*. 

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
big_data <-read_csv("taxi_2016.csv")
#big_data <- filter(big_data, PULocationID == 255 | PULocationID == 256 | DOLocationID == 255 | DOLocationID == 256 | #(between(pickup_latitude, 40.697936, 40.725179) & between(pickup_longitude, -73.969910, -73.936482)) | #(between(dropoff_latitude, 40.697936, 40.725179) & between(dropoff_longitude, -73.969910, -73.936482)))
#write_csv(big_data, "taxi_data_2016_wb.csv")
df1 <-subset(big_data, select = c(2, 6, 7, 20)) %>%
  filter( PULocationID == 255 | PULocationID == 256 | (between(pickup_latitude, 40.697936,
    40.725179) & between(pickup_longitude, -73.969910, -73.936482))) %>%
  mutate(month =  month(as.POSIXct(tpep_pickup_datetime, format = "%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S"))) %>%
  group_by(month) %>% tally()

# Repeat above algorithm for dropoffs
df2 <-subset(big_data, select = c(3, 10, 11, 21)) %>%
  filter( DOLocationID == 255 | DOLocationID == 256 | (between(dropoff_latitude, 40.697936,
    40.725179) & between(dropoff_longitude, -73.969910, -73.936482))) %>%
  mutate(month =  month(as.POSIXct(tpep_dropoff_datetime, format = "%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S"))) %>%
  group_by(month) %>% tally() 

df3 <- merge(df2, df1, by = "month", all.x = TRUE) %>%
  mutate(tot_pass = n.x + n.y) %>%
  subset(select = c(1, 4))

write_csv(df1, "wb_taxi_2016_pu.csv")
write_csv(df2, "wb_taxi_2016_do.csv")
write_csv(df3, "wb_taxi_2016_NOPASS.csv")
```

Add a new chunk by clicking the *Insert Chunk* button on the toolbar or by pressing *Cmd+Option+I*.

When you save the notebook, an HTML file containing the code and output will be saved alongside it (click the *Preview* button or press *Cmd+Shift+K* to preview the HTML file). 

The preview shows you a rendered HTML copy of the contents of the editor. Consequently, unlike *Knit*, *Preview* does not run any R code chunks. Instead, the output of the chunk when it was last run in the editor is displayed.
